response: narrative=Marian Whitehead, a 10-year-old girl, was reported missing from her home on Golf Course Road, Livingston. On the day of her disappearance, she was supposed to attend music lessons, but never arrived. Her grandfather mentioned that she had recently been talking about visiting a foreign country. A friend noted that Marian was fascinated with vehicles and often discussed sneaking into parked cars for imaginary trips. She was also due to collect medication but failed to do so. A search was conducted, focusing on areas known to be associated with vehicles. Marian was eventually traced to 42 South Oswald Road, Edinburgh, in good health, having made her way there via public transport.

Ultimately, she was found safely by police in a vehicle-related incident in South Groathill Avenue, Edinburgh.

narrative=Marian Whitehead, a 12-year-old, went missing from her home on Golf Course Road, Livingston. Concerns escalated due to the high-risk classification.
